name: Bengaluru fort heritage walk
description: Discover the history of the Bengaluru fort on this walk. The Fort though today reduced to a mere fraction of its original expanse—less than 5%—remains one of the most significant remnants of the city’s pre-colonial past. This heritage walk invites you to step into the vestiges of a fort that once bore witness to battles transitions of power architectural ingenuity and political resilience.The fort began as a modest mud structure before being fortified with stone during Hyder Ali’s rule and later expanded under his son Tipu Sultan. These walls though weathered by time preserve within them the layered narratives of a growing urban center and the complexities of South Indian resistance to British expansion.A highlight of the walk is the iconic Tipu Sultan’s Summer Palace a rare example of Indo-Islamic architecture with its intricate wooden pillars frescoes and elegant symmetry. Once the seat of royal administration and leisure the palace offers insights not only into architectural aesthetics but also into the socio-political life of the Sultanate in the 18th century.As we navigate the narrow lanes of Old Bengaluru one encounters a little-known but historically important site: a surviving armoury tucked into the urban sprawl and forgotten by modern maps. Used during Tipu’s reign this structure is a physical testament to the city’s martial past and the strategic importance of Bangalore in Mysore’s military planning.A focal point of this walk is the Battle of Bangalore (1791) a critical campaign during the Third Anglo-Mysore War. The battle pitted the British East India Company against Tipu Sultan’s forces and highlighted not only the military prowess of the Sultanate but also broader geopolitical shifts—especially the fallout of British actions in other global theatres such as in the American Revolutionary War.It is particularly notable that the Mysorean rockets used innovatively during this time caught the attention of British military observers. Some of these designs later found their way into documentation that would influence the development of European—and even American—military technology. Legend holds that they partly inspired Francis Scott Key’s reference to "the rockets' red glare" in the Star-Spangled Banner.Finally the walk concludes with a return to the present—by way of South Indian culinary tradition offering participants a curated local snack and a cup of filter coffee. A reminder that history does not only reside in books or ruins—it lives on in tastes traditions and memories.This walking tour is not just about stones and structures. It is a curated window into Bengaluru’s transformation—from fortified stronghold and seat of regional power to colonial outpost and finally to modern metropolis. In walking its paths we do not merely observe history; we retrace it.Note : "This walk is led by a Bengaluru native and professional architect who has lived and studied in the vicinity of the fort for over three decades. His deep-rooted connection to the area combined with his architectural expertise gives him an intimate knowledge of not just every corner of the fort but also the rich history that surrounds it."

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

description: Join us on this exclusive Ramzan Iftar party in Fraser town where our guests get to feast on a spread consisting of more than 12-14 different courses of Muslim cuisine from different parts of the country.Some of the dishes available to taste are Harira Samosas Brain puffs Haleem Kutt Sheermal naan with chicken/mutton gravy 2-3 types of biryani desserts like egg pudding khubani ka meetha Shawarma rolls Quail sheekh kebabs Double ka meetha Khoya naan Chauba puri and naan Halwa puri etc. Some of the delicacies to be served will be home-made & are not available anywhere. In between all these food you get some great Sulaimani chai too.In between bites get a few bytes of the local history as well as the tradition of Ramzan & fasting in Islam.+++NOTE : All dishes mentioned are subject to availability.+++Some old snaps here-https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1462870957356656.1073741830.1455202794790139PS: In order to enjoy this feast please fast during the day.#Ramzaniftarwalk #iftarwalk #ramzanfood #frasertownfoodwalk #mosqueroadfoodwalk

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group”
description: Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R. People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Food In Literature Book Club
description: Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.  So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.January Read: In the Beginning there was Bombay Duck by Pronoti DattaWe assure you that you will enjoy every single bite! The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who love to read and eat!When: Saturday, 31st January, 2026 at 11 a.m.Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira NagarAges: 18+Registration is mandatory (link in bio)Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: The Bougainvillea Circle
description: "Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: Pitch and Pair: Pitch your single friend
description: Got a single friend who’s a total catch? 👀This is your chance to be the ultimate wing-person. Create a fun 3–5 minute slide deck hyping them up - their quirks, charm, and best qualities - and pitch them to a room full of singles. (Age ~21-35 yrs)But Pitch & Pair isn’t just about the presentations — it’s a full evening designed to spark real connections:🎲 Connection Hunt: A playful way to turn strangers into familiar faces.🎤 Friend Pitches: Hilarious, heartfelt presentations that will have the room cheering.💌 Secret Match Reveal: Where the real chaos — and the magic — begins. All revealed at the end!🍸 Single-Mingle Party: Stay back for drinks and conversations that dating apps can’t create.Whether you’re pitching a friend, cheering them on, or just there to meet new people — this is your night to laugh, mingle, and maybe leave with a story worth telling.

name: Poetry Open Mic
description: Event Name: Mohlat: Zamaane ke fasaane seTheme: Poetry, Storytelling & Unfiltered ConversationsIn a city that runs on deadlines, traffic, and endless scrolling, when was the last time you truly paused?Mohlat (meaning 'respite' or 'grace period') is not just an event; it is a sanctuary carved out of time. We invite you to "Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening dedicated to the art of slowing down.This is a space where the noise of the world fades away, replaced by the rhythm of poetry and the warmth of stories. Whether you are a Shayar with a diary full of couplets, a storyteller with a memory to share, or a listener looking for sukoon (peace), you belong here.WHAT TO EXPECT ✨ The Mehfil Vibe: Forget cold auditoriums. Imagine warm lights, floor seating (cushions and rugs), and a circle of strangers who feel like old friends.🎙️ The Open Mic: The stage is open to everyone. Hindi, Urdu, English, or Hinglish—language is no barrier when the emotion is real. Share your Nazms, Ghazals, or free-verse stories.☕ Chai & Guftagu: What is a poetry session without tea? Enjoy light refreshments and engage in meaningful conversations during our breaks.WHO IS THIS FOR?The Writer who has been hiding their poetry in the Notes app.The Listener who finds comfort in the words of others.The Soul looking to disconnect from screens and reconnect with people.NOTE: This is a zero-judgment zone. You don't need to be a professional performer. You just need to be authentic.

location.address: 17, 6th H Main Rd, Gaurav Nagar, Phase 7, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Kothnur, Karnataka 560078, India

organizer.name: Mohlat
organizer.description: The world is loud, fast, and relentless. It rarely grants us a pause. But at Mohlat, we believe in stealing a moment from time itself.  Join us for "Mohlat-Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening of poetry, storytelling, and unfiltered expression.

name: Federica Colangelo Acquaphonica presents “Forward”
description: About Aquaphonica:Acquaphonica is a contemporary jazz project led by Italian pianist and composer Federica Colangelo, conceived as a long-term creative laboratory where composition, improvisation, and cross-cultural rhythmic research converge.The trio explores a personal musical language shaped by contemporary jazz, 20th-century Western music, and South Indian Carnatic rhythmic traditions, with a strong focus on form, texture, and collective interaction.The current project, Forward, expands the trio format through the special participation of Carnatic percussion master B.C. Manjunath, deepening the rhythmic dimension and opening new perspectives on groove, time, and improvisation.About the artists:FEDERICA COLANGELO: piano, compositionFederica Colangelo is an Italian pianist and composer born in Rome. After studying classical piano at the Royal School of London, she moved to the Netherlands in her early twenties, where she continued her studies in jazz piano and later in contemporary composition.During her years in the Netherlands, she founded Acquaphonica, a project conceived from the outset as a creative laboratory for her original music. With Acquaphonica she has released three albums of original compositions: Private Enemy (2012), Chiaroscuro (2016), and Endless Tail (2019). The fourth album, Forward, is forthcoming and will be presented in October 2025.Her work is characterized by continuous exploration and experimentation, drawing from jazz improvisation and compositional practices, 20th-century European and American music (including influences such as Charles Ives, Philip Glass, John Cage, and Igor Stravinsky), and the rich rhythmic traditions of South Indian Carnatic music. These elements form the basis of her distinctive compositional voice.Alongside Acquaphonica, Colangelo writes and arranges music for various ensembles. Notable works include Undecided (2010) for a 14-piece orchestra, composed during a close collaboration with Dutch composer Otto Ketting and later performed and recorded by the HKU Conservatory Youth Orchestra. In 2014 she arranged six traditional Bulgarian songs for string quintet, presented at the Apollonia Art Festival (Bulgaria). In 2016 she arranged her composition Graphic Work (from the album Chiaroscuro, Alfa Music) for the Civica Big Band, performed at Teatro Piccolo di Milano within the “New Generations” series.In May 2024 she launched Advaita Crescendo, an international quintet formed in Amsterdam, bringing together Indian and Western musicians: veena virtuoso Dr. Suma Sudhindra, flutist and composer Ned McGowan, percussionist Karthik Mani, bassist Laurent Peckels, and Federica Colangelo on piano. The project blends European composition with Carnatic melodic, rhythmic, and improvisational concepts in the search for a shared musical language.She is also active in the duo Timelines with vocalist Giulia Cianca, currently working on an album inspired by the life and writings of Joyce Lussu.Since 2021, Federica Colangelo has been teaching Jazz Composition at the Conservatories of Campobasso and Udine.Throughout her career she has collaborated with numerous internationally active musicians and performed at festivals and venues across Europe and India.IGOR LEGARI – double bassIgor Legari is an Italian double bassist, improviser, and educator based in Rome since 2011, where he is an active presence in the jazz and improvised music scene.His trio ARBO, with Marco Colonna and Ermanno Baron, released its debut album in 2022 on Folderol Records, receiving widespread critical acclaim, including being cited among the best Italian jazz albums of the year. In March 2024 he recorded Something About It, the debut album of Fabrizio Sferra’s new quartet featuring Francesco Bearzatti and Giovanni Guidi, to be released by Parco della Musica Records.Legari is a member of Ettore Fioravanti’s Opus Magnum, with which he has released two albums (Opus Magnum, AlfaMusic 2019; Attraverso ogni confine, Parco della Musica Records 2022). He is also part of pianist Francesco Negro’s trio, with whom he has recorded three albums between 2011 and 2022.He collaborates extensively with composer Teho Teardo, both for film and fashion soundtracks and for live multimedia productions. Together with Susanna Buffa, he created the project Quando l’Anarchia Verrà, dedicated to libertarian songs of the 19th and 20th centuries, published in December 2024 by Kurumuny.A founding member of the trio LUZ, he has toured extensively across Europe and recorded two albums for Auand Records. He has also been a key figure in the Roman improvisation collective Franco Ferguson.Legari holds a diploma in Jazz Double Bass from the Conservatorio di Santa Cecilia in Rome and a degree in Sociology. He has taught Jazz Ensemble at the Conservatorio “F. Morlacchi” of Perugia.GIOVANNI NARDIELLO – drumsBorn in 1995, Giovanni Nardiello began his musical journey at a young age, influenced by his father. He started his professional career at 16, performing in projects ranging from indie rock to pop, experiences that led him to open concerts for major Italian artists such as Marlene Kuntz, Thegiornalisti, and members of Afterhours.In parallel, he began studying jazz in 2015, focusing on improvisation and contemporary languages. He studied with leading figures of the international jazz scene, including Gregory Hutchinson, Ziv Ravitz, Jim Black, Stefano Battaglia, and Ralph Alessi.In 2021 he moved to Tallinn, where he studied Contemporary Improvisation at the Estonian Academy of Music and Theatre and took part in masterclasses with artists such as Marc Ribot and Le Quan Ninh.He has been involved in several award-winning projects, including the Alessandro Pennino Trio, which won the Val d’Agri Jazz Festival and recorded the album Memento (2019, WoW Records). His project Perspectives was a finalist at the Premio Isio Saba 2023.In 2022 he released Kairi with the trio Triologic, featuring guest trumpeter Ralph Alessi. Currently based in Siena, he is working on his first album as a leader while collaborating with numerous contemporary jazz and experimental ensembles.SPECIAL GUESTB.C. MANJUNATH – Carnatic percussionB.C. Manjunath is one of the leading exponents of South Indian Carnatic percussion of his generation. Trained within the traditional Carnatic system, he is internationally recognized for his mastery of mridangam and konnakol, as well as for his ability to engage in cross-cultural musical contexts.Active both in India and internationally, he has collaborated with leading figures of Indian classical music and with musicians from the jazz and contemporary music worlds. His work is distinguished by a deep rhythmic sophistication, precision, and a strong sense of musical dialogue.Within Acquaphonica – Forward, Manjunath’s participation expands the trio’s rhythmic framework, introducing Carnatic rhythmic concepts into an open improvisational context. His presence plays a central role in redefining time, groove, and interaction, contributing decisively to the project’s sonic identity.

name: Serious Slice
description: Welcome to Naples. Well, almost. At Serious Slice, we take our Napoli roots very seriously. Every dish, every process is driven by a deep obsession with Neapolitan pizza and the streets that shaped it, where time, fire, and simplicity do the heavy lifting.Our dough ferments for 72 hours before it ever meets the flame, creating crusts that are light, airy, and blistered just the way Napoli intended. The tomatoes are always San Marzano, bright and balanced. The mozzarella melts soft and gentle. Every pizza carries the soul of a city that takes its food personally.Whether you swear by the OG Margherita or chase bolder flavours, the craft always remains the constant.At our flagship on Cunningham Road, we’ve kept things honest and unfussy. Walk through the blue doors and you enter a warm, intimate space — mosaic art on the walls with quiet nods to Naples, and the crackle of fire you hear instantly from our open kitchen. No backstage. Just dough, flame, and movement.With just 40 seats and an open kitchen, Serious Slice is intimate, warm, and always led by the food and the craft.Weekends are seriously special: Every weekend, we roll out two limited-edition pizzas that don’t stick around for long. Tartufo-E-Fungi – with button mushrooms, capers, pecorino cheese, and a heady drizzle of truffle oil — earthy, bold, and seriously indulgent. Napoli Salsiccia – with Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella, onion, red paprika, and button mushrooms — smoky, spicy, and unapologetically Napoli. Available only on weekends, and when they’re gone, they’re gone.We’re open every day from 12 PM to 11 PM — perfect for lazy lunches, late dinners, and everything in between. We also roll out frequent off-menu pizza and panuozzo drops — one-day-only creations that appear without warning and disappear just as fast, in limited quantities every time. description: Welcome to Naples. Well, almost. At Serious Slice, we take our Napoli roots very seriously. Every dish, every process is driven by a deep obsession with Neapolitan pizza and the streets that shaped it, where time, fire, and simplicity do the heavy lifting.Our dough ferments for 72 hours before it ever meets the flame, creating crusts that are light, airy, and blistered just the way Napoli intended. The tomatoes are always San Marzano, bright and balanced. The mozzarella melts soft and gentle. Every pizza carries the soul of a city that takes its food personally.Whether you swear by the OG Margherita or chase bolder flavours, the craft always remains the constant.At our flagship on Cunningham Road, we’ve kept things honest and unfussy. Walk through the blue doors and you enter a warm, intimate space — mosaic art on the walls with quiet nods to Naples, and the crackle of fire you hear instantly from our open kitchen. No backstage. Just dough, flame, and movement.With just 40 seats and an open kitchen, Serious Slice is intimate, warm, and always led by the food and the craft.Weekends are seriously special: Every weekend, we roll out two limited-edition pizzas that don’t stick around for long. Tartufo-E-Fungi – with button mushrooms, capers, pecorino cheese, and a heady drizzle of truffle oil — earthy, bold, and seriously indulgent. Napoli Salsiccia – with Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella, onion, red paprika, and button mushrooms — smoky, spicy, and unapologetically Napoli. Available only on weekends, and when they’re gone, they’re gone.We’re open every day from 12 PM to 11 PM — perfect for lazy lunches, late dinners, and everything in between. We also roll out frequent off-menu pizza and panuozzo drops — one-day-only creations that appear without warning and disappear just as fast, in limited quantities every time. Follow us so you never miss our flavour drops. We take loyalty seriously: Collect stamps on your Serious Passport and chase the flavour. Ask our staff to give you our loyalty card - to win free panuozzos and pizzas of your choosing. Please Note: We’re a 40-seater, so reservations are recommended on weekends. Limited specials and collab menus are first-come, first-served. Panuozzos take a little extra time — they’re worth the wait. Special events and collabs may run on timed seating.Serious Slice, Cunningham Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka.

name: Serious Slice
description: Welcome to Naples. Well, almost. At Serious Slice, we take our Napoli roots very seriously. Every dish, every process is driven by a deep obsession with Neapolitan pizza and the streets that shaped it, where time, fire, and simplicity do the heavy lifting.Our dough ferments for 72 hours before it ever meets the flame, creating crusts that are light, airy, and blistered just the way Napoli intended. The tomatoes are always San Marzano, bright and balanced. The mozzarella melts soft and gentle. Every pizza carries the soul of a city that takes its food personally.Whether you swear by the OG Margherita or chase bolder flavours, the craft always remains the constant.At our flagship on Cunningham Road, we’ve kept things honest and unfussy. Walk through the blue doors and you enter a warm, intimate space — mosaic art on the walls with quiet nods to Naples, and the crackle of fire you hear instantly from our open kitchen. No backstage. Just dough, flame, and movement.With just 40 seats and an open kitchen, Serious Slice is intimate, warm, and always led by the food and the craft.Weekends are seriously special: Every weekend, we roll out two limited-edition pizzas that don’t stick around for long. Signed copies of the book will be on sale.The following are sample extracts from reviews on Amazon globally and on Goodreads:• India: “INDISHMAN reminded me of the lyrical beauty of Arundhati Roy, the vivid storytelling of Salman Rushdie, and the magic of García Márquez.”• UK: “A lovely meander through the vagaries of human nature. Each story warms the heart like a good malt whisky. A very well-written book; I defy anyone not to enjoy it.”• USA: “It (INDISHMAN) is hard to slot into a specific genre – the stories, reflections and gentle musings flit from rural Kerala to Nepal, from Southampton to the high seas with ease. They strike the perfect balance between being sharply observed and deeply memorable, yet light enough for an effortlessly enjoyable read, and never without a touch of humour and heart. Without a doubt, this has been the best six dollars and change I’ve spent in a very long time.”

name: Recipeat Bar Crawl
description: Step into an intimate, bartender-led journey through Central Bangalore’s most exciting cocktail spaces. The Recipeat Bar Crawl is not about hopping bars blindly—it’s a curated, guided experience designed for people who care about what’s in the glass, who’s behind the bar, and the stories that shape every pour.This edition brings together 5 distinct bars, each with its own personality, united by one theme: Bartender’s Specials. At every stop, guests are served exclusive, off-menu cocktails crafted specifically for the crawl, using a premium spirit portfolio. No repeats. No standard menus. Just thoughtful cocktails and the people who created them.This crawl is co-hosted by Ishrat Kaur and PourHouse studiosWHAT MAKES THIS CRAWL SPECIAL:🍸 Bartender-Led ExperienceEach bar features two bespoke cocktails, with bartenders personally walking guests through the inspiration, ingredients, and techniques behind every serve. It’s storytelling in a glass.🚌 Guided & Seamless FlowA private van moves the group between venues, ensuring a smooth, safe, and relaxed experience. You focus on the drinks—we handle the logistics.👥 Curated Crowd (20 Guests Only)This is an intentionally small group of cocktail-forward professionals, creatives, and F&B explorers. The result: meaningful conversations, no chaos, and genuine engagement at every stop.📍 Central Bangalore CircuitFrom intimate listening bars and wine dive spaces to neighbourhood cocktail institutions, the route showcases the diversity of Central Bangalore’s nightlife culture.📸 Built for Memory & MomentsProfessional photography, crawl passports stamped at every venue, light social games, and take-home collectibles make this more than a night out—it’s a keepsake experience.Also its a great value for money!EVENT FLOW (AT A GLANCE)Kick-off & First Pour – Introduction to the crawl and the first signature cocktailThe Crawl (7:00–9:00 PM) – 3–4 bars with ~45 minutes at each venueGrand Finale (9:30–10:00 PM) – Final bar, social games, closing drinks & collectiblesWHO THIS IS FOR:Cocktail lovers curious about mixology and ingredientsUrban professionals with a taste for curated nightlifePeople who prefer quality over crowdsAnyone who believes a great drink deserves a great story

name: Dinner with strangers by StepOut (Bengaluru)
description: Serendipity on a TableStepOut Dinners bring strangers together at some of the city’s best restaurants for an evening that feels easy, warm, and unexpectedly meaningful.You are seated at a small, thoughtfully curated table with people you would likely never meet otherwise. Different backgrounds, different stories, one shared meal. The crowd is balanced, open minded, and there by choice, not chance. No loud networking. No awkward icebreakers. Just good food, unforced conversations, and the kind of listening that rarely happens in daily life.The restaurants are carefully chosen. Comfortable, well loved spaces where you can settle in and talk without rushing. The focus is not on the menu alone, but on the atmosphere that allows connection to unfold naturally.Some nights are light and playful. Some go deeper than expected. Some surprise you quietly. That is the point.StepOut Dinners are not about dating or outcomes. They are about discovery. Showing up. Sitting down. Letting the table do its quiet work.Sometimes, all it takes is one seat at the right table for life to feel a little more open. For more information, visit www.stepout.world

name: Sheethala - The Winter Kitchens of Karnataka
description: This winter, come spend an unhurried afternoon on a working farm right inside the city.At a time when the land is resting and winter produce is at its best, this gathering brings together food, art, and the farm itself. Just a short ride from the metro, the space feels like a pause from the city, where you can slow down, breathe a little, and spend time outdoors.The experience begins with a guided walk through the farm, where you will see what is growing during winter and learn about seasonal vegetables from Karnataka. We will talk about what grows in this season, why it grows, and how different regions traditionally cook with these ingredients.After the walk, you will sit down between the fields for a relaxed conversation about winter produce, followed by a watercolour painting session by Sangeetha Alwar from Mysore. Surrounded by pumpkins, greens, and roots, you will paint winter vegetables as still life. No prior art experience needed. This is about observing, experimenting, and enjoying the process.In the afternoon, a seated five course meal will be served on the farm by Ole Project. Each course highlights winter vegetables in comforting and creative ways, with small stories from Kannadiga kitchens shared along the way.Before you head back, you will get to harvest fresh greens from the farm yourself and take them home. This is not a rushed event. It is meant to be slow, grounding, and joyful.

name: Tarot: For Yourself
description: Tarot for YourselfA lighthearted introduction to everyday intuitive readingTarot is not about prediction or being “gifted”.It is a language of symbols, stories, and intuition - something we all have access to.This 2-hour experiential workshop is an invitation to explore tarot as a tool for self-reflection and everyday guidance, especially if you’re curious, new, or have been learning through books and YouTube but want a more embodied understanding.Rather than memorising card meanings, we’ll focus on:•⁠  ⁠How tarot actually works as a mirror for your inner world•⁠  ⁠Learning to trust your intuitive responses to the images and symbols•⁠  ⁠Understanding the structure of the tarot (without going card-by-card)•⁠  ⁠How to ask grounded, empowering questions for yourself•⁠  ⁠Simple ways to read tarot for daily life, clarity, and decision-makingWe’ll also touch upon:•⁠  ⁠The difference between tarot and oracle cards•⁠  ⁠How to choose a deck that feels aligned with you•⁠  ⁠How to begin (or return to) tarot without feeling overwhelmedThe session will include interactive exercises, intuitive games, shared reflections, and an open Q&A - creating a relaxed, supportive space to explore and learn.This workshop is ideal for:•⁠  ⁠Beginners and curious explorers•⁠  ⁠People who already pull cards but doubt their interpretations•⁠  ⁠Anyone wanting to build a personal, intuitive relationship with tarotCome as you are. Curiosity is enough.

name: "I Like to Move It, Move It!" with Shena Gamat
description: In BANGALORE!I LIKE TO MOVE IT, MOVE IT! - Dancing for Non Dancers A movement playshop / discovery lab, with Shena GamatThis is not a ‘class’ in the sense of a teacher and students. Rather, it’s an open lab in which Shena will help you find new ways to think of movement and your body. Little tricks and tips, as well as some broad, universal principles - all in an effort to discover the joy of moving in new and creative ways.Some may call it “dance” some may call it “what in the world are you doing?” - but everyone will agree that it’s fun!All you need is loose, comfy clothing and an open mind. Age and so-called ‘ability’ absolutely no bar.Curiosity and JoyNo expectations, no ‘right’ and ‘wrong’Only discovery…***ABOUT SHENATheatre, Movement & Voice Artist + Training ConsultantThese days, Shena mostly potters around her little flat in Delhi, enjoying the parks and sunshine of the lovely winter months. Other than that, she is also a Master Facilitator with Syngrity Transformation Solutions, a voice over artist, actress, theatre director and founder of It’s All Good.***ABOUT ORANGE ARC COMMUNITY STUDIONestled in the quiet of Cooke Town in Bangalore, Orange Arc Community Studio is a home-like, traditional grounded space, curated to nurture opportunities for individuals to live their stories in its most authentic form. We encourage bringing alive experiential journeys that reflect our deep connection with the heart, inspiring creative awareness, joys of loving peace, harmony, alignment, and holistic well-being.We offer this safe space to empower experiences through- Meditation, Mindfulness, Movement, Yoga- Community Circles - Listening, Support, Meet-Ups, Learning Circles- Workshops/ Courses focused on Well-Being, Mental Health, Learning & Development- Dance, music, theatre, art, cultural events- Counseling, Healing & TherapyInsta: https://www.instagram.com/orangearc.community/***ABOUT IT’S ALL GOOD | The Science and Art of JoyIAG is an initiative aimed at returning to joy in a complex world. IAG offers workshops, talks, performances and micro-festivals that explore the human condition, delving into how to live with ease and clarity (and humour!).Insta : https://www.instagram.com/itsallgood.space

name: Sita’s Yoga: The Yoga of Awakening: Book Reading
description: Join us at Atta Galatta for a book reading with Dena Merriam, author of Sita’s Yoga: The Yoga of Awakening, a reflective and spiritually resonant work that reimagines Sita as a guide for inner transformation.In this book, Dena Merriam explores Sita not only as an avatar of the divine Narayani, but as a compassionate presence in the lives of ordinary people—those navigating family, work, duty, and the search for meaning. Through these encounters, the narrative turns inward, examining the everyday battles we face with anger, greed, fear, arrogance, and indifference. Ravana emerges as a powerful symbol of the forces that pull human consciousness toward materialism and delusion, both in Sita’s time and our own.Written with clarity and depth, Sita’s Yoga: The Yoga of Awakening invites readers to look within, to recognise and transform the shadows of the mind and heart, and to discover how inner awakening becomes the foundation for confronting the challenges of the outer world.Date: Sunday, 1 FebruaryTime: 5:00 PM – 7:00 PMVenue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru

name: Taste Test Kitchen with Copper+Cloves
description: For one night, The Studio at Copper + Cloves becomes a live laboratory, and you're invited into this creative process.This is a menu in the making and you get to decide what goes in it.What you will consume here are dishes that don't exist yet. Could be reimagined classics, wild experiments, plant-based innovations that might excite you, make you reach out for seconds or....not.Between courses, you're not just listening, you're analyzing. Discussing texture, balance, that thing you can taste but can't quite name. By evening's end, you've dissected dishes that might never be served again—or that might become menu legends because of what happens in the duration of this meal.Welcome to The Taste Test Kitchen.Copper + Cloves is where Bangalore's food community comes to see what's possible when plants become the priority, not the compromise. Inventive, uncompromising, unapologetically delicious. Through The Studio by Copper + Cloves, they're expanding their vision of wellness beyond what's on your plate—into movement, mindfulness, and holistic care.Origin Fresh has reimagined what "fresh" means in food consumption today—partnering directly with 5,000+ farmers to deliver produce within 12 hours of harvest, not days. With a "fresh or nothing" commitment, they're the reason this evening's experimental dishes start with ingredients at their absolute peak.This is an Urbanaut Production. We map the spaces where travel, art, culture, and food intersect to build experiences at those coordinates. Every event is a discovery: of flavor, of performance, of community, of the city reimagined through a different lens.

name: Within the Mind Lantern: Book Signing
description: Within the Mind Lantern, is a beautifully collection of 41 poems, that has been very well received by the early readers. It is thoughtfully divided into four soul-stirring sections that reads like a gentle walk through memories, emotions, and quiet self-realization. With this poetry collection, the author lights small lanterns within the reader’s mind, guiding them inward. The first section, poems on Nostalgia and Memories, feels like revisiting old photographs, bittersweet, familiar, and deeply comforting. They remind us how memories shape who we are, even when they hurt a little. In the section - Love, Family and Relations, the author captures the beauty of connection, the fragility of bonds, and the unspoken love that often lives between silences. The section on Nature, with gentle metaphors, the poems flow effortlessly, grounding the reader while offering moments of calm and reflection. The final section, Personal Growth and Inspiration, feels like a soft hand on your shoulder, encouraging, reassuring, and deeply empowering. They remind us that growth is personal, nonlinear, and beautifully imperfect. Within the Mind Lantern is not meant to be rushed. It is meant to be felt, revisited, and held close on quiet days. A luminous collection that speaks to the heart, this book is a perfect read if you are looking forward to reconnecting with yourself!Readers are invited to meet the author and get their copies signed at Atta Galatta.

name: Founders' Breakfast: Edition II
description: A gathering of India’s curious minds - founders who question, challenge, and imagine differently. This isn’t a panel. It’s not networking. It’s a thought experiment over coffee. Expect provocative questions, impossible ideas, and brave conversations at the edge of technology, wellness, and human design. A breakfast for those who build - and dare - to reimagine the future.Step into the second edition of Coro's Founders' Breakfast; After Creativity: The Age of Responsibility. Creativity is no longer rare. It’s institutionalized, systematized, and increasingly automated. AI can generate ideas. Organizations can manufacture novelty. Originality, by itself, no longer differentiates.This brunch is a conversation for founders who sense that something has shifted; from making ideas to shaping systems, from being creative to being responsible. Not about how to be more creative. But about what kind of future we’re quietly building through what we choose to create - and what we choose not to.Limited seats. Big questions. And only real talk.

name: Italian Fresh Pasta & Tiramisu Workshop
description: SPCECIAL OFFER: 2 TICKETS FOR LESS (at checkout)Date night/ family night: Come with a friend, partner or your kid and bond the Italian way. Or come solo and get paired with a new friend!Chef Natasha Celmi, who is trained and lived in Italy with her Southern Italian husband, is now in Bangalore at Canella Studio.Transport yourself to beautiful Italy in a cosy ambience of Italian music and food that is straight from an Italian home- fresh, flavourful and hits the spot! Upgrade your everyday with a masterclass in making fresh pasta dough. You’ll roll, shape and cook it to perfection, then knock up a delicious sauce for an undeniably satisfying bowlful. Aprons on!The menu is fresh hand rolled gnocchi (mini pasta pillows with a potato and flour dough) in the Chef's signature Italian pomodoro or pesto sauce and the most decadent grandma's secret tiramisu.What will you do:Make your own gnocchi dough from scratch, roll and shape the gnocchi and cook them.Demo by the chef of the two sauces- Italian tomato and pesto which you use later to toss your gnocchi in. Recipes will be shared for everything.Get to work making and layering your own mini tiramisu which you can take home to share with others...or enjoy it over dinner with your cooking mate.Sit down at the beautiful dinner tables at the studio to enjoy your pasta dinner while chatting with other guests and making new friends, or just bond with your date partner!Suitable for beginners and advance cooks- open to all!

name: Prakriti Pravaham
description: About the Event:Vidhushi Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi will be presenting a Carnatic violin concert with a theme inspired by the 5 elements of nature. She will be accompanied by Vidwan Tumkur Ravishankar on the mridangam and Vidwan Pramath Kiran on the Tabla and Morsing. The concert will take place on 21st Feb from 6-8pm at Courtyard Koota, Kengeri and tickets can be purchased at courtyardkoota.comAbout the ArtistsLalgudi VijayalakshmiA fifth-generation musician of the illustrious Lalgudi bani, Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi, daughter and disciple of legendary musician, Lalgudi G Jayaraman, is an artiste who engages both deeply and variedly with her music. As a violinist, she performs solo, duet, as an accompanist and collaborates with artistes across genres. She is also an accomplished vocalist, a composer, and a teacher. As a composer, besides musical compositions such as thillanas, varnams and krithis, she has also composed both lyrics and music for full length dance dramas, and set to tune works of great poets. With a sparkling four-decade-long journey in music, Vijayalakshmi has been recognized for her music through a slew of awards and accolades, including the most prestigious Sangita Kalanidhi by The Music Academy. A compliment she holds as particularly special is one that Pandit Ravi Shankar ji, the legendary sitar maestro showered on her, following her performance in the United States a few years ago - “You have your father’s fingers. Your music has touched my soul”. In her trust Krutagnya (Sanskrit for gratitude), Vijayalakshmi has been working to create awareness about the varied aspects of music and provide a stage for budding violinists from different schools to showcase their talent.S G Pramath KiranS G Pramath Kiran, a distinguished percussionist, music producer, and sound engineer, is a leading musician in India. Having embarked on his musical journey at the age of 3, he possesses expertise in both Carnatic and Hindustani music. Renowned for collaborations with top musicians worldwide, he founded Laya Digi Studios, producing numerous records. Notably, he's a featured artist in a Grammy award-winning album Devine Tides by Ricky Kej, showcasing his exceptional musical prowess.Tumkur B. RavishankarTumkur B. Ravishankar is a senior Mridangam artist and a Top Grade Artist of All India Radio and Doordarshan. He hails from a family of traditional Mridangam musicians. He began his training under his father, Sri Tumkur T. V. Bhadrachar, and later received advanced training from the renowned maestro Guru Sri Karaikudi R. Mani.Known for his clarity and control across both slow and fast tempos, Ravishankar has accompanied many leading Carnatic musicians. He has performed extensively in India and abroad and has received several titles and awards. He is currently associated with Akashvani, Mysuru, as a Top Grade Mridangam Artist.Tickets are mandatory for all.*

name: Mile Sur | Celebrating India Through Music
description: Mile Sur is a music event to mark Republic Day.The evening brings together musicians from different parts of the country, singing in languages that are not often heard on mainstream stages.The idea is simple: to celebrate the diversity of India through music.Each artist performs in their own language and musical tradition. The event does not try to blend these styles into one. Instead, it places them side by side—allowing each voice, region, and sound to be heard on its own terms.The ArtistsAlva Kuuto (Karnataka)A contemporary folk band rooted in the rhythms, stories, and musical forms of Tulu-speaking regions, Alva Koota brings coastal traditions alive through percussion-heavy arrangements and collective singing.Nganthoibi Ningthoujam (Manipur)A vocalist grounded in Manipuri folk traditions, Nganthoibi’s music carries the lyrical and melodic sensibilities of the Northeast—intimate, reflective, and deeply tied to land and ritual.Martand Badoni (Uttarakhand)A singer and composer working with Garhwali folk, Martand’s music draws from mountain life, migration, and everyday emotion—songs that travel orally across generations in the Himalayas

name: Blackout Poetry & Haiku: A Creative Workshop
description: I am so pleased to invite interested participants to an inspiring poetry workshop led by internationally published poet and physician Dr. Vaishnavi Pusapati. Scheduled for 7th February 2026 from 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM, the event will explore the art and craft of Blackout Poetry and Haiku, inviting participants to creatively reimagine text and discover poetic expression in unexpected places. Blackout is a form of erasure and found poetry where existing text material such as newspaper clippings and journal pages are used as raw material and the phrases that stand out to a poet, are highlighted to form a new, often unrelated to the text in meaning, poem. It is a technique used to overcome writer's block as well. Haiku is a short form of Japanese poetry focused on attention and detail. In this workshop we will also explore haiku techniques such as the cut word and season word and how to edit your haiku better, through examples and worksheet exercises.Dr. Vaishnavi Pusapati is a distinguished physician-writer whose poetry and micro-fiction have appeared in numerous prestigious literary journals and anthologies around the world. Her work has been featured in publications such as Cold Moon Journal, Autumn Moon Journal, Heron’s Nest Journal, Poetry Pea Journal, Haikuniverse, Under the Bashō, and many others, earning recognition for its lyrical precision and contemplative depth. She is also the winner of the Beyond Words micro-fiction contest and her haiku have been anthologized in the Living Haiku Anthology and the Haiku Registry. Her haiku book, Afterlife:haikus is forthcoming from Hawakal Publishers. Her creative practice spans haiku, free verse, monostich, and other forms that illuminate the subtle moments of lived experience. Through her work, she invites readers and writers alike to engage deeply with language, memory, and the transformational possibilities of brevity.The Blackout Poetry & Haiku Workshop will provide attendees with hands-on exercises, guided techniques, and creative prompts designed to nurture individual expression and literary play. Art supplies and refreshments will be provided. Whether you are a seasoned writer or a curious beginner, the session promises to unlock new ways of seeing, connecting and writing.Age Group: 30 - 60 years

name: Pint of View (Lecture 34): Ten Million Fireflies
description: Ten Million Fireflies: What the night reveals when we learn to look: finding wonder, purpose, and policy in the darkMost of us here know this feeling. That sudden urge to leave the city behind. To drive out late at night, or take a trip to a remote village or up into the hills. Just to look up and catch a glimpse of a meteor shower. To see the galaxy with our own eyes. To sit in the dark long enough for stars to appear. And sometimes, if we’re lucky, to spot fireflies flickering in the distance.But then we return. To brighter streets, whiter lights, glowing windows. And slowly, without quite noticing, the night becomes something flatter. Emptier. Easier to ignore.A few years ago, while searching for stars near his home in India, Sriram noticed the same disappearance we often do. The stars were harder to find. But something else caught his attention instead. Large populations of fireflies, glowing steadily in the dark.The night, it turns out, is Sriram’s natural habitat. Under skies full of stars and forests alive with fireflies, he found not just wonder, but purpose. An engineer by training, working at Google, he made an unlikely choice. He left the job and move towards the night.What makes someone do that? How can looking up at the sky, or down at a firefly, redirect an entire life? And can stories, told well enough, change how we light our cities, protect our forests, and shape public policy?In this Pint of View lecture, Sriram will take us into the jungles after sunset. Into rare firefly behaviours, fragile nocturnal habitats, and the unseen costs of artificial light. He will share how astronomy, photography, and storytelling became tools for conservation, and how paying attention to the night can still change everything.About the Speaker:Sriram Murali has a deep passion for astronomy, fireflies, and the night. He tells stories that emotionally connect people to the wonders of the night and to the ill effects of losing it. His films on starry skies and light pollution have inspired many to look up, take action, influence policymakers, and champion dark-sky movements.Through his work on fireflies in the Western Ghats, Sriram has influenced state governments to address light pollution in India. He is a National Geographic Explorer and an IUCN SSC expert on fireflies and light pollution. Sriram and his team at Wild and Dark Earth (an NGO) collaborate with scientific institutions, government bodies, and the lighting industry to restore natural darkness for wildlife.Event detailsDate: Sunday, 1 February 2026Time: 6 PM – 8 PMVenue: 1st Floor, Atta Galatta, IndiranagarWhat your ticket includes1 complimentary sober beverage (soda, kombucha or gingerale from Local Ferment Co.)
